identificationModule.briefTitle: Randomized Controlled Study of the Effectiveness of IV Fluid Infusion in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke (IVIS)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Randomized Controlled Study of the Effectiveness of IV Fluid Infusion in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke (IVIS)

statusModule.whyStopped: More progressive stroke in one arm

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Division of Neurology, Department of Medicine, Faculty of Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To study the result of intravenous fluid in patients with acute ischemic stroke within 72 hours.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study aims to find the effect of early IV fluid administration to patients with acute ischemic stroke on the neurological outcome and to determine the side effects of intravenous fluids. Due to its cost effectiveness and wide accessibility, the possible application or use of IV fluid infusion as first line treatment can aide in the treatment of more acute ischemic stroke patients worldwide. This novel information will aide physicians with more comprehensive understanding of the efficacy of utilizing IV fluid in future treatment plans for patients with acute ischemic stroke.

armGroups.label: IV Fluid
armGroups.description: 0.9% NaCl solution infusion: 100 ml/hr for three days.

armGroups.label: No IV Fluid
armGroups.description: Not receive any intravenous fluid but can consume oral fluid normally for three days.

interventions.name: 0.9% NaCl solution
interventions.description: 0.9% NaCl solution intravenous infusion: 100 ml/hr for three days.

primaryOutcomes.description: Patients with good outcome by NIHSS ≤ 4 at day 7 after treatment or on the day of discharge, which ever comes first.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: day 7 after treatment or on the day of discharge

secondaryOutcomes.description: Patients with mRS ≤ 1 at day 7 after treatment or on the day of discharge, which ever comes first.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: day 7 after treatment or on the day of discharge

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of change of serum osmolarity at day 3 after treatment

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Age from 18-80 years
2. NIHSS ≥ 1
3. Diagnosis of acute ischemic stroke within 72 hours from stroke onset
4. Enrollment into the study within 24 hours after hospital arrival
5. Urine specific gravity level \< 1.030
6. Patient consent

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Patients receiving \> 40 ml/hr IV fluid infusion over 3 hours
2. Acute ischemic stroke caused cardiogenic embolism
3. Urine specific gravity ≥ 1.030
4. Large cerebral infarction area

   1. Infarction \> 1/3 of middle cerebral artery area
   2. Infarction \> 1/2 of cerebellar hemisphere
5. NHISS ≥ 18
6. Previous or current episode of atrial fibrillation
7. Previous or current episode congestive heart failure
8. Previous echocardiogram with ejection fraction \< 40%
9. Previous or current episode of dilated cardiomyopathy
10. Abnormal renal function GFR ≤ 60% or serum creatinine ≥ 2
11. Modified Rankin scale before acute ischemic stroke ≥ 2
12. Patients receiving intravenous thrombolysis
13. NPO with need for IV fluid
14. IV fluid infusion needed from any other causes
15. Patients with poor prognosis with life expectancy \< 90 days
16. Patients involved in other ongoing clinical studies
